column4: if X is running, you can look at /var/log/Xorg.0.log, it'll tell you a lot about your driver and how it's loaded
the software that provides the framework for your graphical desktop. If you have a desktop, X is running
It says Permission denied when I run that
read. try less /var/log/Xorg.0.log in a terminal, or open it with gedit
I dont know what I am looking for in that log
somewhere around line 300 or so the file will tell you the driver it's used, and the cards it supports
Is this Bad or Good::::::::::::::::::::::(II) Primary Device is: PCI 01:00:0
depends :) If you put the whole thing on a pastebin, I'll take a look
Okay, sounds good, where is the pastebin?
looks just fine; you're using the open source ati driver
My screen is a little bit jerky running effects, but thought it shouldnt with that card
that WW was a warning that you had not explicitly defined the video card's slot, but X found it anyway
Thank you so much for helping me out and taking a look at it.....
ati drivers suck. They just do
